abstract: Damion Hardy, who was convicted of six murders and of running drug gang in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, in late 1990s and early 2000s, is sentenced to life in prison without possibility of parole.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hardy, 40, was convicted of six murders and of running a drug gang out of a Brooklyn housing project in Bedford-Stuyvesant in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

headline.main: Emotions Run High as Damion Hardy Is Sentenced to Life Term for Killings
headline.print_headline: Emotions High as Killer Gets Life Term
